project.name: CloudKid OS API
project.description: CloudKid OS API: A framework for HTML5 content built on top of createjs

cloudkid.CacheManager.name: cloudkid.CacheManager
cloudkid.CacheManager.description:
Used for managing the browser cache of loading external elements
can easily load version manifest and apply it to the media loader
supports cache busting all media load requests
uses the query string to bust browser versions.

cloudkid.LoaderQueueItem.name: cloudkid.LoaderQueueItem
cloudkid.LoaderQueueItem.description: Represents a single item in the loader queue

cloudkid.MediaLoader.name: cloudkid.MediaLoader
cloudkid.MediaLoader.description:
The Medialoader is the singleton loader for loading all assets
including images, data, code and sounds. MediaLoader supports cache-busting
in the browser using dynamic query string parameters.

cloudkid.MediaLoaderResult.name: cloudkid.MediaLoaderResult
cloudkid.MediaLoaderResult.description: The return result of the MediaLoader load

cloudkid.Application.name: cloudkid.Application
cloudkid.Application.description:
An application is an abstract class which extends `createjs.Container`
and is managed by the `cloudkid.OS`

cloudkid.Button.name: cloudkid.Button
cloudkid.Button.description:
A Multipurpose button class. It is designed to have one image, and an optional text label.
The button can be a normal button or a selectable button.
The button functions similarly with both CreateJS and PIXI, but slightly differently in
initialization and callbacks.

- Initialization - the parameters for initialization are different. See the documentation for initialize().
- [PIXI only] Use releaseCallback and overCallback to know about button clicks and mouse overs, respectively.
- [CreateJS only] Add event listeners for click and mouseover to know about button clicks and mouse overs, respectively.

cloudkid.DragManager.name: cloudkid.DragManager
cloudkid.DragManager.description:
[CreateJS only] Drag manager is responsible for handling the dragging of stage elements
supports click-n-stick and click-n-drag functionality

bind.name: bind
bind.description:
[CreateJS only] Designed to provide utility related to functions, the
most important of which is the `bind` method, used to properly scope callbacks.

cloudkid.OS.name: cloudkid.OS
cloudkid.OS.description:
Designed to mimic the feature-set of the CloudKidOS for AS3
Provides a staging framework for other things to load
handles the stage query string parameters, provides debug tools,
as well as browser cache-busting.

params.name: imageSettings
params.description:
Information about the art to be used for button states, as well as if the button is selectable or not.
			If this is an Image or Canvas element, then the button assumes that the image is full width and 3 images
			tall, in the order (top to bottom) up, over, down. If so, then the properties of imageSettings are ignored.

props.name: image
props.description: The image to use for all of the button states.

props.name: up
props.description: The rectangle information about the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
			trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: over
props.description: The rectangle information about the over state. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
			trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: down
props.description: The rectangle information about the down state. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
			trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: disabled
props.description: The rectangle information about the disabled state. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
			trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
			trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.name: highlighted
props.description: The rectangle information about the highlighted state. If omitted, uses the over state.

props.name: selected
props.description: The rectangle information about the over state. If omitted, the button is not a selectable button.

props.name: src
props.description: The sourceRect for the state within the image.

props.name: trim
props.description:
Trim data about the state, where x & y are how many pixels were 
			trimmed off the left and right, and height & width are the untrimmed size of the button.

props.description: (CreateJS only) the framerate for mouseover effects, higher is more responsive

props.name: debug
props.description: If we should enable the Debug class for doing console and remote logs

props.name: minLogLevel
props.description: The minimum log level for the Debug class, default is show all statements, values from 0 (all)-4 (errors only)

props.name: ip
props.description: The IP address for doing remote debugging

props.name: parseQueryString
props.description: If we should convert the query string into OS options

props.name: showFramerate
props.description: To display the current framerate counter

props.name: clearView
props.description: Auto clear the stage render

props.name: backgroundColor
props.description: (PIXI only) The background color of the stage as a uint, e.g. 0xFFFFFF for white.

props.name: preMultAlpha
props.description: (PIXI only) If the renderer is to use pre multiplied alpha for all images. This only affects the WebGL renderer.

props.name: transparent
props.description: (PIXI only) The stage is transparent

props.name: width
props.description: (PIXI only) The width of the renderer, default is the canvas width

props.name: height
props.description: (PIXI only) The height of the renderer, default is the canvas height

props.name: forceContext
props.description: (PIXI only) The stage renderer, options are "canvas2d", "webgl" or null. Omitting this (or null) uses WebGL if available, and Canvas2D otherwise.

props.name: raf
props.description: Use the request animation frame instead of a setInterval

props.name: fps
props.description: Set the framerate

props.name: versionsFile
props.description: The text field to store cache-busting versions for individual files

props.name: basePath
props.description: The base path to load all files from (useful if using a CDN)

props.name: cacheBust
props.description: If all file requests with the MediaLoader should be cacheBusted (e.g., "file.mp3?cb=123123")

params.name: imageSettings
params.description: Information about the art to be used for button states, as well as if the button is selectable or not.

props.name: up
props.description: The texture for the up state of the button.

props.name: over
props.description: The texture for the over state of the button. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: down
props.description: The texture for the down state of the button. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: disabled
props.description: The texture for the disabled state of the button. If omitted, uses the up state.

props.name: highlighted
props.description: The texture for the highlighted state of the button. If omitted, uses the over state.

props.name: selected
props.description: The texture for the selected state of the button. If omitted, the button is not a selectable button.

props.name: scale
props.description: The scale to use for the textures. This allows smaller art assets than the designed size to be used.

params.name: label
params.description: Information about the text label on the button. Omitting this makes the button not use a label.

props.name: type
props.description: If label.type is "bitmap", then a PIXI.BitmapText text is created, otherwise a PIXI.Text is created for the label.

props.name: text
props.description: The text to display on the label.

props.name: style
props.description: The style of the text field, in the format that PIXI.BitmapText and PIXI.Text expect.

params.name: enabled
params.description: Whether or not the button is initially enabled.

classitems.description: [PIXI only] The callback for when the button is moused over.
classitems.name: _onOver

classitems.description: [PIXI only] The callback for when the mouse leaves the button area.
classitems.name: _onOut

classitems.description: [PIXI only] The callback for when the button receives a mouse down event.
classitems.name: _onDown

classitems.description:
[PIXI only] The callback for when the button for when the mouse/touch is released on the button
- only when the button was held down initially.
classitems.name: _onUp

classitems.description: [PIXI only] The callback for when the mouse/touch is released outside the button when the button was held down.

classitems.description: The position x, y of the mouse down on the stage

classitems.description: The position x, y of the object when interaction with it started.

classitems.description: Is the drag being held on mouse down (not sticky clicking)

classitems.description: Is the drag a sticky clicking (click on a item, then mouse the mouse)
classitems.name: isStickyClick

classitems.description: If sticky click dragging is allowed.

classitems.description: Callback when we are done dragging

classitems.description:
Manually starts dragging an object. If a mouse down event is not supplied as the second argument, it 
   defaults to a held drag, that ends as soon as the mouse is released.
classitems.name: startDrag

params.name: object
params.description: The object that should be dragged.

params.name: interactionData
params.description: The interaction data about the input event that triggered this.

classitems.description: Mouse down on an obmect
classitems.name: _objMouseDown

params.name: type
params.description: The type of input that triggered this call - either TYPE_MOUSE or TYPE_TOUCH.

params.name: object

params.name: doCallback
params.description: If the drag end callback should be called. Default is false.

classitems.description: Internal stop dragging on the stage
classitems.name: _stopDrag

params.name: doCallback
params.description: If we should do the callback

classitems.description: Update the object position based on the mouse
classitems.name: _updateObjPosition

classitems.description: Simple clamp function

Adds properties and functions to the object - use enableDrag() and disableDrag() on 
objects to enable/disable them (they start out disabled). Properties added to objects:
_dragBounds (Rectangle), _onMouseDownListener (Function), _dragMan (cloudkid.DragManager) reference to the DragManager
these will override any existing properties of the same name
classitems.name: addObject

classitems.description: Removes properties and functions added by addObject().
classitems.name: removeObject

classitems.description: Destroy the manager
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Remove a saved variable by name.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the value to remove

classitems.description: Save a variable.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the value to save

params.name: value
params.description: The value to save. This will be run through JSON.stringify().

params.name: tempOnly
params.description: If the value should be saved only in the current browser session.

classitems.description: Read the value of a saved variable

return.description: The value (run through JSON.parse()) or null if it doesn't exist

classitems.description:
AMF 3 JavaScript library by Emil Malinov https://github.com/emilkm/amfjs
based on Surrey's R-AMF (AMF 99) implementation https://code.google.com/p/r-amf
For more information on R-AMF (AMF 99), including Java (Spring) R-AMF server
see http://www.reignite.com.au/binary-communication-using-ajax-and-amf

classitems.description: Enum for big or little endian.

Attempt to imitate AS3's ByteArray as very high-performance javascript.
I aliased the functions to have shorter names, like ReadUInt32 as well as ReadUnsignedInt.
I used some code from http://fhtr.blogspot.com/2009/12/3d-models-and-parsing-binary-data-with.html
to kick-start it, but I added optimizations and support both big and little endian.
Note that you cannot change the endianness after construction.
